page.title: 15Standard Fireworks
page.content: Standard Fireworks is one of only a few firework producers in the country. Over sixty million fireworks are made each year and sold in this country and abroad. The factory covers one square mile of disused quarries, well away from local houses in case of accidents. The fireworks are made in lots of small huts called danger buildings where often only four people are licenced to work. Some of the workers wear fireproof clothing and masks. A lot of the work is done by hand. Fireworks are stored in large buildings called magazines. Apart from importing some cardboard tubes, the whole manufacturing process is carried out on the site. Nearly 500 people are employed at Standard Fireworks, of whom 70% are women.
